column1: naiṣa doṣaḥ /

column2: And it is through this aqueous body that they are enabled to experience the joys of Heaven That is to say, when the last oblation has been poured into the fire and the body has been burnt, the water rising out of the body goes up along with the smoke, and having enveloped the sacrificer his soul, it reaches the Lunar Region and becomes the material of which the external body of the sacrificer is built up,just as straw and clay form the material in the making of the ClayIdol;

column1: tadārabdhena ca śarīreṇeṣṭādiphalamupabhuñjānā āsate //

column2: QuestionWhen one has reached the Lunar Region as the result of his Kārmic force, and descends from there,does this descent take place after the total exhaustion of that force? Or, while there is still some remnant of it left?Well, what if it is?If the entire Kārmic force is exhausted, then Liberation should follow immediately, while the man is still in the Lunar Regions as on exhaustion of the Kārmic force, there is nothing that can keep him from Liberation;

column1: tata āgatasyeha śarīropabhogādi na sambhavati /

column1: na ca teṣāṃ candramaṇḍala upabhogaḥ /

column1: ato 'kṣīṇāni tāni /
